ai.summary: A 13.8 km moderate hike near Hindhead in the UK, combining heathland, woodland and gentle climbs with rewarding views over the surrounding Surrey countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-surfaced paths and gravel tracks with some sections of uneven ground and occasional boggy patches after rain. Expect short ascents onto open heath and longer stretches along sheltered woodland trails.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for daylight hours; weather can change quickly on exposed heath. Wear sturdy footwear and bring waterproofs. Carry a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, a whistle, and enough food and water. Stay on marked trails, watch for uneven surfaces, and be cautious on wet leaves and mud.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of delays)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for pleasant conditions and clearer views; summer can be hot and exposed on open sections; winter visits require extra care due to shorter daylight and potential icy paths.

seo.title: Highcombe Hike, Hindhead – 13.8 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Highcombe Hike near Hindhead, UK. A 13.8 km moderate hike through heathland and woodland with scenic Surrey views. Tips on gear, safety, and best seasons.
